definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: Walter's spiteful remarks were quite uncalled for.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾特惡意的話完全是多餘的。

sentences.english: The unified symmetry and conserved quantity of the holonomic mechanical systems with remainder coordinates are studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究有多餘座標完整系統的對稱性與守恆量。

sentences.english: Superflous wealth can buy superfluities only.
sentences.chinese: 多餘的財富只能買來不需要的東西。

sentences.english: Avoid extra words and qualifying phrases.
sentences.chinese: 不要用多餘詞彙和限制性短語。

sentences.english: Please wipe excess oil from engine nacelles and landing gears.
sentences.chinese: 擦掉髮動機吊艙和起落架上多餘的油。

sentences.english: I agree totally with the criticisms of excess in pay and bonuses.
sentences.chinese: 我全然同意關於多餘的工資及獎金的批評。

sentences.english: It is the misunderstanding and misdoing of the philosophy to make the medical philosophy become unnecessary with the medicine.
sentences.chinese: 使哲學成爲醫學多餘是那種對哲學的錯誤理解和做法。

sentences.english: Otherwise, you're wasting a bit, so to speak, unnecessarily.
sentences.chinese: 否則，你就浪費了一個比特位，也就多餘了。

sentences.english: Change in rent will not affect human behavior, it is a surplus. (2)
sentences.chinese: 租值的轉變不會影響人類行爲，這是多餘的。

sentences.english: My mother never withdraws her savings to buy unnecessary things.
sentences.chinese: 母親從不支出積蓄去買多餘之物。

sentences.english: This is necessary in order to remove excess silver salts.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做很有必要，作用是去除乳劑中多餘的銀鹽。

sentences.english: For Mr. Duan, Chinese New Year is just more unwanted time off.
sentences.chinese: 對段先生來說，中國農曆新年根本就是個多餘的假期。

sentences.english: "Vocalise" is a song in which words would truly be superfluous.
sentences.chinese: 交流如果是可能的，所有的詞語應該都是多餘的。

sentences.english: Families would often organize working teams from their surplus labor and send them around to do work for others.
sentences.chinese: 各農戶常把多餘的勞力組織起來實行換工。

sentences.english: Pattern-recognition technologies are making numerous highly paid skills redundant.
sentences.chinese: 圖像識別技術使得無數的高薪技術人員變得多餘了。

sentences.english: A complex creative intelligence with nothing to do is not just redundant.
sentences.chinese: 一個無所事事的複雜的創造性智慧不僅僅是多餘的。

definition: within the body/in vivo (vs in vitro)/internal to
to handle/to treat/to deal with/to process/to deal with a criminal case/to mete out punishment/to offer for sale at a reduced price/to punish
as much as possible/to the greatest extent
to be capable of/to be able to/can
